data.title: Fresh Food and Fun Atmosphere
data.text: Great bistro that offers an eclectic array of Asian inspired cuisine. Large portions, fresh ingredients, and great service are all part of the charm of this restaurant. I had the Green Papaya salad with tofu and it was excellent. Several options for vegetarian eaters.  Dumplings were great, soups and salads were huge.  Great spot for a business lunch.

data.title: Eclectic asian fusion menu
data.text: We didn't know what to expect, but were pleasantly surprised.  Reasonable prices, interesting menu.  We enjoyed the yellow curry and the sushi did not disappoint.

data.title: Very fresh Asian-inspired food
data.text:
My boyfriend had the Wok Shaken sea bass with brown rice and I had the soba noodles with a tomato-based sauce with large shrimp. Both dishes stood out for tasting freshly made with quality ingredients. I was full but I couldn't stop eating it. We also had some chicken garlic dumplings as an appetizer which were moist and flavorful.

The service was excellent. Happy hour is anywhere in the restaurant, not just at the bar. We'll be back.

data.title: Asian fusion=confused food
data.text: We tried hoisin ribs served with terrible kimchi & Specialty roll of Red Dragon which are both edible.  Not likely to go again.

data.title: Excellent asian fusion with a stong Thai influence.
data.text: Thai, sushi, and fusion dishes can be had here.  The food is excellent and very fresh, and the portions are large enough for groups of six to easily share.  The servers are also very friendly and accommodating.  The bar has a nice spirit selection, and serves well above average labels, like Johnny Walker Black for well scotch.

data.title: Don't get excited...
data.text: Nothing to be excited with, food is just regular but its good. The place looks nice, I like it. When we were there for dinner, there are only 2 servers for the whole place.

data.title: Streets
data.text:
I went here for lunch based on recommendation from colleagues at work.
Off the main street, but a nice place. 
The service was great and the food was amazing. The decor is nice and everything was clean. I would definitely recommend this place and come back again.

data.title: Downhill
data.text: Sushi has gone way down hill since the original chef quit - quality of fish is the problem. Only the pineapple fried rice is OK to eat.

data.title: Food is good - service is horrible
data.text: This place has wonderful food.  The service is never good (have been about 6 times and service is consistently bad). They are almost always short staffed. Bartender is also a waiter/waitress for the tables so watch out if you get them as your server and people show up to just sit at the bar. The food is great.  The acoustics of this restaurant are not very good.  It is hard to hear people talking at your own table. Also this is not a good place to go with groups larger than 5. If you get food to go, you will really like it.

data.title: Little bit Sushi, little bit vietnamese, a hidden gem
data.text: My wife and I found this hidden gem shortly after it opened. It has been a favorite ever since. We usually start with the Fresh Spring Rolls, Pork Belly variety. It is hard to leave the Starters section without ordering Sriracha Hoisin Honey Pork Belly Steamed Buns. If meet is not your thing, they have several vegetarian starters as well. My favorite entree is the Compound Butter with Sea Bass (which I assume is a french influenced Vietnamese recipe; I mean butter in an asian dish) Tres Bon.

data.title: Great decor but so so food
data.text: My friend and I visited for the first time.  We were very impressed with the nice contemporary decor.  We ordered Pa Thai, and it was drenched in a strong heavy sauce, not at all tasting like the traditional Pa Thai you get at a Thai restaurant.  Probably won't return.

data.title: Different flavors than what is traditional
data.text: I like the location. Easy to park. The restaurant has room so you don't feel crammed in.  It is wheelchair accessible. Clean, attractive setting. Menu should please everyone and lunch specials look appealing. I ordered the universal "Pad Thai". It was a good serving with lots of chicken, the down side was it had a very noticeable sweet taste. Like sugar added. I was surprised . I did not like it at all. It came with crumpled peanuts on top, not much else. It was a disappointing choice. I also ordered the Pho soup with the rare steak. I was abit surprised in the meat choices other than chicken. The soup broth was an unusual taste, like it had cinnamon added. That too I never had before. The rare steak was awful! tough, I could not eat this soup. Perhaps this is a new version of Vietnamese flavors. Sadly I did not like either dish. I will go back for the lunch special and give it another go. The siracha honey hoisin baby back ribs looked awesome!

data.title: Love this place!
data.text: Great, friendly service! Lots of variety on the menu. Something for everyone. Real creative sushi dishes and good quality fish. The staff is a true gem! They will keep you returning for the great service. Good happy hour and craft beer selections!

data.title: Excellent food, good service, low price
data.text:
The only not so good thing about this restaurant is the location. It is not bad but it is hidden behind 2 garages on a side street and somehow invisible to the public. But once you know about it you will be "hooked" on it. 
The food is delicious, with a large diversity of dishes from sushi to soups and noodles and many other Vietnamese or South East Asian foods. They have a much larger variety than the classic Pho places. 
The soup itself is different much richer in ingredients. The drinks have awesome prices and at happy hour (everyday between 4 and 7) all drinks are cheaper. same goes for a list of tasty appetizers.
The service is incredibly fast and the waiters are so friendly and helpful. 
What can you ask for more? we loved it and we will be back overtime when we want some good exotic food.

data.title: A hidden gem.
data.text: My hsband and I are always on the hunt for a great sushi restaurant and discovered this place.  The service was good and the food was delicious.  They had recently had a change of ownership and remodeling and we were pleased with the completely new overhaul of this restaurant. They did not have a dessert offering at the time we went, because the daughter of the owner said they were carefully choosing the right dessert choices to be placed on the menu.  I would suggest that they had that figured out prior to opening though.

data.title: STREET'S, SUSHI AND MUCH MORE!
data.text:
When you watch Danny, the Sushi chef at Street's, he is artistry in motion! He puts together the most colorful, interesting and tasty dishes imaginable.
My personal favorite is his Sashimi salad. Wow, what a dish! Six different types of raw fish with a pile of delicious greens with delictable dressing, and all for $16.00. 
It makes a great dish to share as it is too much food for one person.
The items on the regular menu are also first class and healthy as well.
They offer a full bar and a great selection of exotic cold or hot saki, beer and wine.
For a real treat, try the newest and best restaurant in all of Thousand Oaks!

data.title: Excellent food - lots of great choices
data.text:
We had trouble deciding what to order as everything sounded so good.  My wife ordered Pad Thai and I ordered E6 Wok shaken House Garlic - lots of chicken and veggies.  Both dishes were delicious!  The ingredients very fresh and the sauces were incredibly flavorful.  Best Pad Thai we have ever had.

Service was fast, helpful and friendly.

Lots of great choices for beer, wine and a full bar.

I can't wait to go back and try more dishes.

data.title: Excellent in every way
data.text: Service fabulous, food fabulous. Will not hesitate to go back. Especially at happy hour 👍 Will have sushi next time - maybe. Couple of other dishes I'd like to try first.

data.title: Visited in August with family
data.text: Visited Streets after reading reviews. Was Friday evening, very busy but not too long of a wait. Tried a little of everything . Ordered sushi, ribs. Spring rolls and pad thai. Ribs were delicious, the sushi was our favorite, very fresh. Oh and the pork belly appetizer, gotta try it. All in all a great experience

data.title: Good atmosphere and service
data.text: Enjoyed the restaurant décor and we could hear at our booth in the corner. Service was excellent.  Enjoyed the eggrolls and fried rice.  Like the idea of choosing the proteins to add to the dish you select.  Other people at the table enjoyed the greenbean dish with fillet.
